poem:
Title: "At Ports of Prejudice"

On racist seas, our judgement sails,  
70% BAME toils under fearsome gales.  
Yet less than one in five pose a threat,  
A stark image of unjust nets.  
Chained within an institution, the unsaid muse,  
Terrifying tales of colours we choose.
In the name of safety, prejudice persists,  
In hands of justice, an unequal fist.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The figures from police logs released to the Guardian under freedom of information laws also show that fewer than one in five". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
